ovdesc.p: The data types defined in SA.DATA.TYPES would be the lowest level data. At times scoring models or score cards would require data that is a sum of low-level data. For example score card may require TOTAL INCOME as one of the data. However, the bank may collect details such as MONTHLY INCOME, BONUS, OTHER INCOME etc., separately. To facilitate such scenarios it is possible to group a set of like data types.

desc.p: Specifies an alternative easy means of referencing the Data Group. Like the ID, the Mnemonic must be unique..
Free format ID to facilitate user defined naming conventions

Identifies the data types that forms a part of the data group. For example the scoring rule may be based on a data TOTAL INCOME. The bank may however collect details such as Income, Incentives, Bonus etc., separately. In such a scenario, these data may be defined as data types. One data group may be defined as TOTAL INCOME comprising the data types. Data types therefore represent lower level of information while the data group represents higher level of information.System would simply aggregate the values of individual data types to arrive at the value of data group.

- Multivalue field to include multiple data types in a data group. - Only like data types can form a part of a data group i.e. data types with same characteristics (NUMERIC for example) can alone be grouped together.
Identifies the Data Group in more descriptive form and will be used for on-line enrichments when this data group is used.Multivalue field to record description in various languages.
